header.#text:
Suspension of
			 fines for first-time paperwork violations by small business
			 concerns

quote.#tail: has the meaning given that term under

section 3 of the Small
				Business Act

text.#text:
In the case of a first-time violation by a small business
				concern of a requirement regarding the collection of information by an agency,
				the head of the agency shall not impose a civil fine on the small business
				concern unless the head of the agency determines that—

the violation has
				the potential to cause serious harm to the public interest;

the violation was
				not corrected on or before the date that is 6 months after the date on which
				the small business concern receives notification of the violation in writing
				from the agency; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the violation presents a danger to the public health or
				safety.

that a violation presents a danger to the public health
				or safety, the head of the agency may, notwithstanding

,
				determine not to impose a civil fine on the small business concern if the
				violation is corrected not later than 24 hours after receipt by the owner of
				the small business concern of notification of the violation in writing.

text.#text:
This subsection shall not apply to any violation by a
				small business concern of a requirement regarding collection of information by
				an agency if the small business concern previously violated any requirement
				regarding collection of information by the agency.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

				violation of a requirement regarding collection of information by another
